snippet: Defense lawyers say David Tarloff was insane when he bludgeoned and stabbed Kathryn Faughey, an Upper East Side therapist, in 2008.
abstract: Jurors begin deliberating on whether David Tarloff’s plan to save his mother, which resulted in his killing Upper East Side psychologist Kathryn Faughey, was product of an insane mind or simply poorly thought-out crime that ended in murder.
lead_paragraph: Defense lawyers say David Tarloff was insane when he bludgeoned and stabbed Kathryn Faughey, an Upper East Side therapist, in 2008.

headline.seo: Case of David Tarloff, Psychologist’s Killer, Goes to Jury
headline.main: Case of Psychologist’s Killer Goes to Jury in Manhattan
headline.print_headline: Case of Psychologist’s Killer Goes to Jury in Manhattan
